item.title: MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates - News18
item.description:
MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates

Date: December 15, 2024, Source: News18

The much-anticipated initial public offering (IPO) of MobiKwik has concluded with impressive subscription numbers, indicating strong market interest.

  • MobiKwik's unlisted shares are trading at Rs 444, a 59.14% rise from the upper price band of Rs 279.
  • The IPO opened for bidding from December 11-13 and was oversubscribed 125.69 times.
  • Retail investors subscribed 141.78 times, while institutional categories showed strong demand.
  • IPO allotment will be finalized on December 16 and listing is scheduled for December 18.
  • The public issue consists entirely of fresh equity shares worth Rs 572 crore.
"The IPO received an overwhelming 125.69 times subscription, showcasing significant interest from investors."

As MobiKwik prepares for its public market debut, it solidifies its position in India's fintech ecosystem.

Companies News Today Live Updates on December 15, 2024: Vedanta to consider fourth interim dividend issue on Monday — December 16

Date: 15 Dec, 2024 Source: LiveMint

Vedanta Ltd's board is scheduled to meet on December 16 to discuss the approval of a fourth interim dividend issue.

Read the full story here

item.title: What Was Net Worth of Isak Andic, The Founder Of Mango Who Has Passed Away In Accident? - News18
item.description:
Isak Andic, Founder of Mango, Dies at 71 in Tragic Accident

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: News18

Isak Andic, the founder of the global fast-fashion brand Mango, passed away at the age of 71 following a tragic hiking accident near Barcelona. His death, announced by the company on December 14, 2024, has sent ripples across the fashion and business communities.

  • His net worth was estimated at $4.5 billion at the time of his death.
  • Mango operates 2,700 stores across 120 markets worldwide.
  • The company achieved a record-breaking €3.1 billion in sales in 2023.
  • Andic also held investments in Banco Sabadell, contributing to his financial portfolio.
  • Spain’s Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez praised Andic’s contributions to the business landscape.
“Isak Andic transformed Mango from a small Spanish store into an international fashion powerhouse.”

Isak Andic’s legacy will continue to influence the fashion industry as Mango expands its reach, particularly in the United States.

item.title: Tata Steel Share Price Target 2024: Company engages with NMDC, OMC for future iron ore supply - BUY, SELL or HOLD? - ET Now
item.description:
Tata Steel Share Price Target 2024: Company engages with NMDC, OMC for future iron ore supply - BUY, SELL or HOLD?

Publication Date: Updated Dec 15, 2024 15:05 IST

Tata Steel is actively seeking to secure its future iron ore supply through negotiations with NMDC and OMC, aiming to substantially increase its production capacity by 2030.

  • Tata Steel operates India’s oldest steel factory in Jamshedpur with a capacity of 11 MTPA.
  • The company has commissioned the largest blast furnace at its Kalinganagar facility, boosting capacity to 8 MTPA.
  • Recent acquisitions have increased Tata Steel’s total production capacity significantly.
  • The company expects to produce 41 million tonnes of iron ore in FY25, needing over 60 million tonnes for its steel production target.

Tata Steel Share Price Target

Analyst Vaishali Parekh from Prabhudas Lilladher has given a 'BUY' recommendation for Tata Steel shares with a target price of Rs 160.

In conclusion, as Tata Steel expands its operations and secures raw materials, it positions itself for growth in the competitive steel market.

item.title: Vedanta to consider fourth interim dividend tomorrow. Check record date - The Economic Times
item.description:
Vedanta to Consider Fourth Interim Dividend on December 16

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: The Economic Times

Vedanta, led by billionaire Anil Agarwal, plans to announce its fourth interim dividend for FY2024-25 on December 16, with a record date set for December 24.

  • The Board of Directors meeting is scheduled for December 16, 2024, to discuss the dividend.
  • This board meeting was previously planned for October but canceled due to unforeseen circumstances.
  • In September, Vedanta declared a third interim dividend of Rs 20 per share, totaling Rs 35 for the fiscal year.
  • The company has declared a total of 45 dividends since July 23, 2001.
  • Trading for Vedanta's securities will be closed from December 12 to December 18.
  • Vedanta shares have increased by 102% year-to-date.
  • For Q2 FY25, Vedanta reported a profit of Rs 5,603 crore, reversing a loss from the previous year.
  • Revenue from operations declined by 4% year-on-year to Rs 37,171 crore.
“The trading window for dealing in securities of the company shall remain closed from Thursday, December 12, till Wednesday, December 18.”

Investors are awaiting the decision on the dividend, which is crucial for shareholders.

item.title: Indian-origin CEO asks if he should get a green card. Elon Musk answers - India Today
item.description:
Elon Musk Responds to Indian-Origin CEO's Green Card Query

Published On: Dec 15, 2024 Source: India Today

In a post on X, Indian-origin CEO Aravind Srinivas sought opinions on whether he should apply for a green card, leading to a brief yet impactful response from Elon Musk.

  • Aravind Srinivas is the CEO of Perplexity AI and has been waiting for three years for his US citizenship.
  • Musk simply replied “Yes” to Srinivas' query, which prompted significant engagement from users on the platform.
  • Previously, Musk expressed frustration over the US immigration system's complexity and its treatment of talented individuals.
  • Srinivas has a notable background, being an IIT Madras graduate and former research scientist at OpenAI.
  • Perplexity AI, founded by Srinivas in 2022, has received support from investors including Jeff Bezos.
“It’s ironic that criminals find it easier to enter the US than intellectuals.” - Elon Musk

This interaction highlights ongoing discussions regarding immigration and the challenges faced by skilled individuals in the US.

item.title: Third-gen Honda Amaze base variant is detailed - CarWale
item.description:
Third-gen Honda Amaze base variant is detailed

Date: N/A Source: N/A

The third-generation Honda Amaze has unveiled its base variant, the V MT, which is priced at Rs. 8.04 lakh. This variant offers essential features while still maintaining some attractive aesthetics.

  • The V MT variant is available with both manual and automatic transmission options.
  • Exterior features include LED headlamps and a chrome strip above the grille.
  • The interior retains design elements from higher-spec models but lacks some features like climate control and a wireless charger.
  • The powertrain includes a 1.2-litre i-VTEC petrol engine, and a CNG option is available as a dealer-fitment.
  • Competition includes the Maruti Dzire, Hyundai Aura, and Tata Tigor, with similar feature levels at varying prices.
“The CNG kit is priced at Rs. 1 lakh but is variant agnostic and can be fitted to any MT variant.”

Overall, the third-gen Honda Amaze’s base variant is designed to appeal to budget-conscious consumers while still featuring Honda's recognized quality and design.

item.title: Top 10 Year-End Discounts On 7-Seater SUVs & MPVs - Up To Rs. 6.5 Lakh - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Top 10 Year-End Discounts On 7-Seater SUVs & MPVs - Up To Rs. 6.5 Lakh

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Gaadi Waadi

With year-end sales in full swing, car manufacturers are offering enticing discounts to clear inventories and attract buyers. Several models have emerged as top contenders in terms of maximum savings, blending cash discounts, exchange bonuses and additional incentives.

  • 1. MG Gloster (MY2023) - Maximum discount of Rs. 6.5 lakh, with Rs. 5.5 lakh in cash benefits and Rs. 1 lakh extra for 2023MY models.
  • 2. Skoda Kodiaq (MY2023) - Offers Rs. 5.5 lakh in savings through cash incentives, leasing advantages, and a two-year maintenance package.
  • 3. Maruti Invicto Hybrid Petrol (Alpha) - Maximum discount of Rs. 2.65 lakh with conditions for financing and vehicle exchange.
  • 4. Jeep Meridian (MY2023 Overland) - Rs. 2.3 lakh discount mostly on its premium trim.
  • 5. MG Hector Plus 7S Diesel (Smart) - Offers Rs. 2.2 lakh in discounts.
  • 6. Mahindra Bolero (B6 Opt) - Includes all bonuses totaling Rs. 1.28 lakh.
  • 7. Mahindra Scorpio Classic (Base) - Comes with savings of Rs. 1.15 lakh including accessories.
  • 8. Toyota Rumion - Rs. 90,000 exchange benefits.
  • 9. Hyundai Alcazar - Rs. 60,000 cash and exchange bonuses.
  • 10. Maruti XL6 Petrol (All Variants) - Rs. 55,000 through scrappage and exchange discounts.

These enticing offers present compelling options for potential buyers looking for big savings as the year comes to a close. Shoppers should act quickly, as these limited-time offers may not last beyond the current sales season.

item.title: OpenAI whistleblower Suchir Balaji found dead in San Francisco; Elon Musk reacts - The Times of India
item.description:
OpenAI Whistleblower Suchir Balaji Found Dead in San Francisco; Elon Musk Reacts

Publication Date: November 26, 2024
Source: Times of India

The AI industry is in shock following the death of 26-year-old Suchir Balaji, a former OpenAI employee and whistleblower, found in his apartment. His allegations of copyright violations against OpenAI were pivotal in ongoing legal disputes.

  • Balaji was discovered during a welfare check; authorities have ruled out foul play.
  • He accused OpenAI of using copyrighted material to train its AI systems.
  • His critic of OpenAI claimed it created unfair advantages and inflated valuations.
  • Balaji's insights were anticipated to impact legal cases against OpenAI.
  • Elon Musk's reaction to the news has sparked further speculation.
“The current model is unsustainable for the internet ecosystem as a whole,” Balaji said.

The loss of Balaji underscores the challenges faced by whistleblowers in the tech industry, emphasizing the need for transparent investigations into such incidents.

item.title: Rs 61 GMP! Rs 3000+ cr IPO allotment details, shares listing date, gains, stock price prediction - ET Now
item.description:
Sai Life Sciences IPO: Key Details and Predictions

Updated: December 15, 2024

Source: ET Now News

The Sai Life Sciences public issue offers significant insights into its subscriber interest and expected gains. The IPO has shown robust subscription rates, with strong grey market premiums indicating potential profits for investors.

  • Sai Life Sciences public issue was oversubscribed 10.27 times.
  • Total IPO size: Rs 3042.64 crore.
  • Share allotment expected by December 16, 2024.
  • GMP ranges from Rs 40 to Rs 61, predicting listing gains.
"Shares of Sai Life Sciences could list at around Rs 610 apiece if the GMP reaches Rs 61."

The IPO's performance and high levels of interest suggest a positive outlook for investors as the share listing approaches.

item.title: Last Chance To Buy Rs 50 Lakh SUV At Price Of Tata Nexon! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Last Chance To Buy Rs 50 Lakh SUV At Price Of Tata Nexon!

Publication Date: November 2023
Source: MotorOctane

This article discusses how buyers can now purchase a luxury SUV, specifically the used Mercedes Benz GLA, at the price of a Tata Nexon, offering an alternative to more expensive new models.

  • Rise in used car market due to increasing prices of new vehicles.
  • The Mercedes Benz GLA features premium interiors and advanced safety equipment.
  • A used 2018 model is available for Rs 16.45 lakh.
“The used Mercedes Benz GLA will be a better and a feature loaded option you could consider to buy instead of Tata Nexon.”

As buyers look for more affordable luxury vehicles, the used car market presents viable options that do not compromise quality.

item.title: Kawasaki Z900 gets a massive discount in India - BikeWale
item.description:
Kawasaki Z900 Receives Major Discount in India

Publication Date: December 2023 | Source: Bikewale

In India, Kawasaki is providing a substantial cash discount on the Z900 motorcycle, likely as part of a stock clearance effort.

  • The Z900 now comes with a Rs 40,000 discount, lowering its price to Rs 9 lakh (ex-showroom).
  • This offer is valid until stocks run out.
  • Additional discounts are available on the Ninja series from Kawasaki.
  • The Z900 is a significant contributor to Kawasaki's sales in India.
  • December is highlighted as an optimal month for purchasing motorcycles due to typical discounts and price increases in January.
“December is a great month to buy new motorcycles and scooters. There are always some good cash discounts available along with other add-ons.”

This substantial discount on the Kawasaki Z900 presents a timely opportunity for buyers looking to purchase a high-performance motorcycle before the year ends.

item.title: IPO Calendar: 11 companies in focus ahead of IPO opening, listing next week - The Economic Times
item.description:
IPO Calendar: 11 companies in focus ahead of IPO opening, listing next week

Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: The Economic Times

The article discusses the upcoming IPOs and listings in the Indian market, indicating a strong finish for the year. It highlights four new IPOs opening for subscription and the listing of shares from nine companies.

  • Mamata Machinery: IPO opens on December 19 and closes on December 23.
  • Transrail Lighting: IPO opens on December 19 and closes on December 23.
  • Newmalayalam Steel: IPO opens on December 19 and closes on December 23.
  • Shares of Dhanlaxmi Crop Science will likely get listed on the NSE SME platform on December 16.
  • Listing of Sai Life Sciences, Vishal Mega Mart, and One Mobikwik Systems expected on December 18.
“Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times.”

This week’s IPO activities emphasize the resilience of the market as it concludes 2024.

item.title: Masterstroke by Infosys as it acquires minority stake in this healthcare deep-tech firm, invests Rs… - India.com
item.description:
Infosys Acquires Minority Stake in 4baseCare to Enhance Healthcare Solutions

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: India.com

Infosys has announced an investment of Rs 8 crore (approximately USD 1.0 million) in the healthcare startup 4baseCare to bolster its innovation in cancer treatment.

  • Infosys acquired a minority stake not exceeding 20% in 4baseCare.
  • This investment is part of the Infosys Innovation Fund.
  • 4baseCare utilizes AI and analytics to improve cancer diagnosis and treatment.
  • The collaboration aims to develop groundbreaking healthcare solutions.
  • Infosys seeks to enhance its service offering to clients in healthcare and life sciences.
“4baseCare provides unique precision oncology solutions leveraging diverse genomic and clinical data.”

The collaboration is expected to facilitate smoother business transformations for Infosys clients in the healthcare sector.

item.title: Dixon Technologies Aims For 40% Annual Topline Growth Over Next 4 Years - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Dixon Technologies Projects 40% Annual Revenue Growth Over Next Four Years

Publication Date: Recent

Source: NDTV Profit

Dixon Technologies is anticipating a significant annual growth in revenue, aiming for up to 40% over the next three to four years, largely due to opportunities in the mobile, IT, and telecom sectors.

  • The company’s revenue has grown from approximately Rs 2,000 crore five years prior to an expected Rs 38,000-40,000 crore by FY25.
  • Chief Financial Officer Saurabh Gupta highlighted a large order book and a broad customer base in the mobile, IT, and telecom categories.
  • Dixon aims for 35-40% annual growth based on newly emergent opportunities.
  • The total mobile market in India consists of approximately 220 million units.
  • Dixon is poised for further growth as its production capacity aligns with market demands, especially in smartphones and feature phones.
  • Gupta mentions potential export opportunities as brands look to India for production.
“A lot of new opportunities are coming to us, which cannot be quantified right now.” - Saurabh Gupta

The outlook for Dixon Technologies suggests promising growth, not just in domestic markets but with potential international deals as well.
